review_title: Employee centred organization. Great place to work
pros: Holistic enrichment of skill set through planning and implementation.
cons: Working in the social sector and travel to remotest areas

pros: Creative writing, Project management, monitoring, effective communicator, donor relationship management
cons: obsessed with perfection, emotional, tendency to go into details

pros: Sightsavers has a very clear mission and generates tremendous outcomes for its beneficiaries. It's a really go-getting culture. I very much enjoyed working there.
cons: Nothing significant. This is a charity which knows its way with a committed management team who drive pretty hard standards across the organisation.

pros: It is one of the biggest INGO who works towards eradicating avoidable blindness from our society and it is a very transparent organization.
cons: Should start a programme where volunteers from different sectors can come and spend their valuable time in helping us in order achieve our organizational goal.

pros: Inspirational founder, compelling cause, clear focus,  excellent learning environment, influential, innovative, great team & partners
cons: Strategic conflicts (in some cases), fast pace of growth could impact on quality & effectiveness in the long term

pros: Small team, not much work presuure
cons: HR was a waste, duped me by putting me in year long probation . Senior management lack professionalism

pros: I'm proud to say I was a part of this organization
cons: There are absolutely no cons to mention

pros: To help blind people made me happy
cons: Work pressure is more but with hard work we can be successful
